title: 113_hr2446
content: The Act may be cited as the "Responsible Consumer Financial Protection Regulations Act of 2013" and establishes the Commission. Section 1011 of the Consumer Financial Protection Act of 2010 is amended to establish a Commission as the head of the Bureau with the authority to prescribe regulations and issue orders necessary for carrying out the title and other laws within its jurisdiction. The Commission shall be composed of the Vice Chairman for Supervision of the Federal Reserve System and 4 additional members appointed by the President with Senate approval. Members must be US citizens with expertise in consumer financial protection. Staggered terms of 1, 2, 4, and 5 years will be established. Each member of the Commission appointed by the President shall serve for a 5-year term and can be removed by the President. Vacancies will be filled for the remainder of the term. Members can continue to serve after their term expires. Members of the Commission appointed by the President serve for a 5-year term and can continue to serve after their term expires until a successor is appointed. They are prohibited from engaging in other employment, and no more than 2 members can be from the same political party. The Chair of the Commission is appointed by the President from among the members appointed under subsection (c)(1). The Chair of the Commission appointed under subsection (c)(1) is the principal executive officer of the Bureau, responsible for all executive and administrative functions, including personnel appointment and supervision, business distribution, and fund use. The Chair of the Commission operates under general policies and regulatory decisions of the Commission. Requests for appropriations must be approved by the Commission. Vacancies in the Commission do not impair the remaining members' ability to exercise its powers. A quorum consists of three members, except when vacancies reduce the Commission to only three members, in which case two members suffice. The Commission operates under general policies and regulatory decisions. Vacancies do not impair its powers. Two members constitute a quorum in case of vacancies. The Commission shall have an official seal. Compensation rates are specified for the Chair and other members. The Commission operates under general policies and regulatory decisions.
